questions.title: What is PropTraka and who is it for?
questions.content:
PropTraka is a property management app designed for landlords and property managers of any scale.

It simplifies rental management by providing a central dashboard to track finances, manage properties and tenants, monitor maintenance, and generate insightful reports, helping you run your portfolio more efficiently.

questions.title: How do I sign up or log in?
questions.content:
You can sign in or create an account using your email and password or your Google account.

Simply head to the Sign In page. If you use an email that isn't registered, an account will be created for you automatically. For a password-free experience, use the 'Sign in with Google' option. If you forget your password, you can use the 'Forgot Password?' link to reset it.

questions.title: How do I navigate the app?
questions.content:
Navigate the app using the main Bottom Navigation Bar and the AI Assistant.

The app's primary navigation consists of:
  • Dashboard: Your home screen with a high-level financial overview.
  • Menu: The central hub to access all features like Properties, Revenue, and Reports.
  • Activity: A real-time feed of all changes made in your account.
  • Account: Manage your profile, app settings, and subscription.
You can also use the floating chat bubble to ask the AI for help at any time.

questions.title: How does the Dashboard work?
questions.content:
The Dashboard gives you an instant, high-level overview of your portfolio's financial health.

It features two main sections:
  • Key Performance Indicators (KPIs): These cards at the top show your most critical live metrics, including Total Property Value, Portfolio Net Worth, monthly Revenue and Expenses, Net Operating Income, and total Arrears.
  • Charts & Graphs: These visuals show your cash flow trends over the last six months and a breakdown of your year-to-date, after-tax profit for each individual property.

questions.title: How do I manage my properties?
questions.content:
Manage all your properties from the 'Properties' page, accessible via the main Menu.

From here, you can add, view, and edit every asset in your portfolio. When adding a property, you can log its address, type (Domestic or Commercial), building specifications, and crucial financial data like its purchase price, current value, mortgage balance, and target rent.

questions.title: How do I track revenue and create a tenancy?
questions.content:
Track income by creating 'Tenancies' on the 'Revenue' page from the main Menu.

Instead of logging one-off payments, you create a tenancy that links a tenant to a property for a specific lease period. When you set the monthly rent, deposit, and any service charges, the app automatically generates an invoice record for every month of the lease, saving you manual data entry.

questions.title: How do I record a payment from a tenant?
questions.content:
Record payments within a specific tenancy's detail page.

First, navigate to Menu > Revenue and click on the tenancy you wish to update. This will take you to the monthly breakdown for that tenant. Find the month you want to record a payment for and use the action menu (...) to select 'Record Payment'. You can then enter the amount paid.

questions.title: How do I manage expenses?
questions.content:
Log all property-related costs from the 'Expenses' page, found in the main Menu.

The expense form lets you categorise each cost (e.g., Repairs, Insurance), link it to a specific property or mark it as a general business expense, and assign it to a contractor. You can also specify if it's a one-off or recurring expense and attach a link to a receipt for your records.

questions.title: How does document management work?
questions.content:
PropTraka helps you organise your documents by storing links to your master templates and to individual, tenant-specific files.

The workflow has two parts:
1. Master Templates: Store the URLs for your master document templates (e.g., Tenancy Agreement, Application Form) in one central place under Account > Settings > Document Templates. The AI Assistant uses these links to give you a personalised onboarding checklist.
2. Tenant-Specific Documents: When you add or edit a tenancy, you can paste in the URLs for the final, signed documents that are specific to that tenant, such as their signed contract or move-in checklist. This keeps all relevant files linked directly to their tenancy record.

questions.title: How do I handle a tenancy that ends early?
questions.content:
End a tenancy early from its detail page to automatically clean up future unpaid rent records.

Navigate to Menu > Revenue and click on the relevant tenancy. In the header, click the 'End Tenancy' button and select the new, earlier end date. The app will automatically find and delete any future, unpaid invoices scheduled after this date, ensuring your financial records remain accurate.

questions.title: How can I see who is behind on rent?
questions.content:
Use the 'Arrears' page from the main Menu to see all overdue payments.

This page automatically lists all tenants with outstanding balances on past-due invoices. It shows you who owes money, how much they owe, and how many days the payment is overdue. From here, you can use the action buttons to send a pre-filled email reminder or initiate a payment request.

questions.title: How do I use the AI Lease Clause Generator?
questions.content:
Generate legally-sound tenancy agreement clauses from the 'Lease Tools' page.

Navigate to Menu > Lease Tools. In the AI Lease Clause Generator, simply describe the rule you need in plain English (e.g., 'a clause about no smoking inside the property'). The AI, acting as a paralegal, will draft a formal, professional clause that you can copy and paste directly into your tenancy agreement template.

questions.title: How do I manage maintenance and repairs?
questions.content:
Manage all maintenance tasks using the Kanban board on the 'Maintenance' page.

This tool lets you visually track jobs from 'To Do' to 'Done'. When creating a request, you can add a description, set a priority, and assign it to a property and contractor. Once a task is marked as 'Done' and a cost is entered, you can instantly create a corresponding expense record with a single click.

questions.title: What kind of reports can I generate?
questions.content:
Generate interactive financial dashboards and formal AI-powered reports from the 'Reports' page.

This section contains two live analysis tabs for Revenue and P&L. Additionally, you can use the AI tools in the header to generate formal documents:
  • AI P&L Statement: Creates a downloadable Profit and Loss statement, complete with a narrative summary suitable for stakeholders.
  • AI Market Research: Generates a detailed analysis of how your rental prices compare to current market rates, with data-backed recommendations.

questions.title: How does the AI Assistant work?
questions.content:
The AI Assistant is a conversational helper that can answer questions and perform tasks for you.

Accessed via the floating chat bubble, the AI uses the app's official Knowledge Base to answer your questions accurately. It also has special capabilities, like the Onboarding Assistant. If you ask it to 'onboard a new tenant', it will use your saved template URLs from Settings to provide a personalised checklist with clickable links to your documents.

questions.title: What is the Calendar for?
questions.content:
The Calendar provides a visual timeline of all key events across your portfolio.

Found in the Menu, it automatically plots important dates from other sections of the app, including tenancy start/end dates, expense transaction dates, and the reported dates of maintenance requests. This helps you anticipate vacancies and track activities at a glance.

questions.title: What is the PropTraka API and who can use it?
questions.content:
The PropTraka API is a powerful tool for developers and businesses on the Enterprise plan to programmatically access their property data.

It allows you to build custom integrations, automate workflows, and sync your PropTraka data with other systems, such as accounting software or business intelligence dashboards. Access is restricted to users on the Enterprise subscription tier.

questions.title: How do I generate an API key?
questions.content:
You can generate and manage your API keys from the 'Account' page.

Follow these steps:
1. Navigate to the Account page from the bottom navigation bar.
2. Select the 'API Access' tab.
3. Click the 'Generate Key' button.
4. A new key will be created and displayed on your screen. Be sure to copy this key and store it in a secure location, as it will not be shown again.

The page will list all your active keys by their creation date and last-used date, though it will only show the last few characters of each key for security.

questions.title: How do I authenticate with the API?
questions.content:
Authentication is done using a Bearer Token in the Authorization header of your HTTP requests.

You must include your generated API key in every request you make. The format is as follows:

Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY_HERE

Replace `YOUR_API_KEY_HERE` with the key you generated. Requests made without a valid key or with an incorrect key will be rejected.

questions.title: What are the available API endpoints?
questions.content:
The API provides read-only access to your core data collections.

The base URL for all endpoints is `/api/v1`. Currently, the following GET endpoints are supported:
  • `/properties` - Retrieves all properties in your portfolio.
  • `/revenue` - Retrieves all revenue transactions.
  • `/expenses` - Retrieves all expense transactions.
  • `/maintenanceRequests` - Retrieves all maintenance requests.
  • `/contractors` - Retrieves all contractor details.
Each endpoint returns a JSON array of the corresponding data objects.

questions.title: What are common API errors and how do I handle them?
questions.content:
Understanding error codes is key to building a robust integration.

Here are the most common errors you might encounter:
  • 401 Unauthorized: This means your API key is either missing, invalid, or does not have permission to access the resource. Double-check your Authorization header and ensure your key is correct.
  • 403 Forbidden: This indicates you are trying to perform an action you don't have permission for, such as using a read-only key for a write operation (not currently applicable as the API is read-only). It may also mean your subscription plan does not include API access.
  • 404 Not Found: You are requesting an endpoint that does not exist. Check for typos in your request URL.
  • 429 Too Many Requests: You have exceeded the rate limit. Please reduce the frequency of your requests. The standard limit is 60 requests per minute.

questions.title: How do I change my settings and profile?
questions.content:
Manage all your preferences from the 'Account' page on the main navigation bar.

Here, you can update your name and password, change the app's currency and date format, set your company name for reports, and switch between Light and Dark mode. This is also where you manage your subscription and billing information, as well as your master document template URLs.

questions.title: How do I manage the AI's Knowledge Base?
questions.content:
(Development Only) You can add, edit, or delete articles in the AI's knowledge base from the 'Account' page.

Under the 'Knowledge Base' tab, you can manage the content the AI Assistant uses to answer user questions. You can seed the database with the default FAQs or create custom articles to tailor its expertise. This tab is only visible in the development environment.

questions.title: What is the Activity Feed for?
questions.content:
The Activity Feed provides a complete audit trail of all actions taken in your account.

Accessible from the main navigation bar, this feed shows a timestamped, chronological list of events like new properties, updated tenancies, logged expenses, and status changes on maintenance requests, making it easy to review all recent activity.
